channel.title: Scar 'Tutor' Needed Please :)
channel.description: Hi, I was wondering if any good SCAR Scripters out there would be willing to help me learn SCAR. I was wondering if it could be through AIM or YIM if you want to. :) I would really appreciate it if somebody would do this. Thanks! Please PM Me or post here if you are willing to. :)

item.title: Scar 'Tutor' Needed Please :)
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

Slave Scyth:

Okay, thanks. Anybody else?

I’ll help. I live in Australia EST Time. And my MSN Address is dudeofthed@cia.gov.

Please tell me your e-mail so i can add it instead of denying it.

Read full topic

item.title: Scar 'Tutor' Needed Please :)
item.dc:creator: @Distort Distort
item.description:
@Distort wrote:

[quote=“Janilabo, post:2, topic:86090”]I’ll tutor you a bit here…

Just head to Tutorial Island of SRL-Forums or SCAR FAQ’s and Tutorials Section of Moparisthebest

Also, I have collected and compiled great resources for people who are interested of SCAR/SCAR Using/SCAR Scripting. You can check em out, too. You actually might find the resources quite useful.

Here:
SCAR Help File
Massive Package of Resources for SCAR

I just don’t believe someone would spend time for teaching someone to script, for free… And when there is already alot of resources for learning available.

-Janilabo[/quote]

Packages are all well and good but if you don’t know what certain things do (lack of proper anitation, which alot of scripters leave out), any programming lanuage can be hard to learn, which is where a tutor comes in to help. I’m not offering to be one (hell, im still learning myself (everyone is)) but if you were to ask questions after thinking about it for a while, then a community of helpers will be much better than just one. Ofcourse you’d have to know who to listen to and who’s words carry weight.

a example: You dont know how “mouse” works, so you look at it in the include (whether it be SRL or library) and try to see how it works. You get to the point where you realise that it moves the mouse humanlike, but you don’t know how it clicks humanlike, you’d ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Scar 'Tutor' Needed Please :)
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

I’ll tutor you a bit here…

Just head to Tutorial Island of SRL-Forums or SCAR FAQ’s and Tutorials Section of Moparisthebest

Also, I have collected and compiled great resources for people who are interested of SCAR/SCAR Using/SCAR Scripting. You can check em out, too. You actually might find the resources quite useful.

Here:

I just don’t believe someone would spend time for teaching someone to script, for free… And when there is already alot of resources for learning available.
